channel.title: I have a couple of viruses. Need help please
channel.description: I took a couple of screenshots of some of the problems incase anyone might know what's going on. I tried to get onto MoparScape when I woke up this morning, and all of my batch files are inaccessible. When I logged on this morning, my Windows OneCare told me it had found viruses named 'onoes.exe' and 'b.exe' . It can't clean them it just quarentines them, which I see does nothing. It won't let me open up task manager or regedit either. It tells me regedit is not a valid win32 application and that another program is currently using it. It also tells me another program is currently using task mgr. It tells me the same thing with MoparScape. Does anyone know the problem and how to fix it and get rid of these damn viruses?

ooo sounds like you need a reformat

item.title: I have a couple of viruses. Need help please
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

apzrman:

What i do when i get a virus i can’t delete is, if my antivirus comes up saying it can’t delete, i follow the path to where it’s supose 2 b and delete the file. easy and saves time!

Why did you bump a 9 month old thread?

[quote=“MybJames, post:15, topic:881”]Ok Javac enlighten me on how to delete C:/

And zoss, im the clueless noob? At least i know how to register a nick. retard[/quote]

Java’s a retard, don’t listen to him.(If you still want to, plop your windows xp disk in and restart, press f12 while starting up and choose format.

item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

Nashiu:

Thanks jme, I’m going to do a restore and make the computer like it was yesterday, because the viruses somehow got here overnight. =\

Most to alot viruses get into your system restore files. They stick to you even if you restore it.

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:13, topic:881”][quote author=MybJames link=topic=772.msg750258#msg750258 date=1168264291]
i laugh at the virus name

onoes.exe

lol
[/quote]

Yeah, C:\ is a virus to. You’d better delete it.[/quote]
Now now, just because you have more intellegence than the clueless noob doesn’t mean you can take advantage over him

item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

go over to my thread sticked up in general section. Download some of those. Go in safe mode like Jamie said, scan your com with everything and if they dont go away get the software called moveonboot (which is also i my thread) and delete them manually.

<3 squg for telling me about Moveonboot.

item.title: I have a couple of viruses. Need help please
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Nashiu:

Thanks jme, I'm going to do a restore and make the computer like it was yesterday, because the viruses somehow got here overnight. =\

Heh, I had a virus a lil while ago that deleted all my restore-points, and my computer couldn't function properly at all, so I had to re-format. It was because of a web exploit(wmf exploit) so I ended up re-formatting. To this day I cant figure out how to get my internet running

Read full topic

item.source: I have a couple of viruses. Need help please

item.title: I have a couple of viruses. Need help please
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Do this:

The second you turn on your computer, start pressing f8 rapidly until it asks you if you wanna go into sfae mode. Say yes. Now that your in safe mode, scan with every virus cleaner you have, and every spyware program you have.

So go download avg anti-virus, and ad-aware, and spybot. Trust me, scanners are much more effective in safe-mode. Take note of the viruses you had if they dont go away even after cleaning them iwth an anti virus, and search google for manual removal. You almost never have to re-format because of a virus, although sometimes you do.

Read full topic
